message.content:
We begin by simplifying each of the square roots:
\begin{align*}
\sqrt{108}&=\sqrt{36\cdot 3}=\sqrt{36}\cdot\sqrt{3}=6\sqrt{3},\\
\sqrt{12}&=\sqrt{4\cdot 3}=2\sqrt{3},\\
\sqrt{27}&=\sqrt{9\cdot 3}=\sqrt{9}\cdot\sqrt{3}=3\sqrt{3}.
\end{align*}Therefore, the fraction is \[
\frac{4}{6\sqrt{3}+2\sqrt{3}+3\sqrt{3}} = \frac{4}{11\sqrt{3}}.
\]Finally, we rationalize the denominator by multiplying the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt{3}$: \[
\frac{4}{11\sqrt{3}}\cdot \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}} = \frac{4\sqrt{3}}{33} = \boxed{\frac{4\sqrt{3}}{33}}.
\]
